channel.title: This stupid Swine Flu shit
channel.description:
I'm a freshman in High School. Today we had our first day of finals. In my school, we have a study period, an exam period, study, exam, and leave. In my second study period, oh quarter after 10 I think?, I was sittin' there, just kinda relaxing. A secretary announces that there is an urget health warning, and one kid from every class had to go down to the office to get like 20 papers. Each of which containing a letter. Maybe I'll post a small picture of this letter, but let me tell you the insanity of the matter (this is a DIRECT QUOTE from the table on the front half):
[b]If your child has both:[/b] "Fever (100.4 degrees F or 38 degrees C) [b][u]AND[/u][/b] sore throat or cough."
I used the word 'degrees' but on the paper it's the degree symbol, which Iunno how to make. Second column, same row:
[b]Then you must:[/b] "[u]Keep your child home for 7 days.[/u] If after 7 days the child still has symptoms, stay at home until symptoms are gone for 24 hours. Your child might have the flu. Other symptoms can include runny nose, body aches, vomiting, and diarrhea."
Can I stress the MIGHT HAVE THE FLU part that was mentioned AFTER the part of staying home for 7 days?
I don't know how everyone else views the Swine Flu, but for fuck sake, they're telling us to stay home for a whole damn week if we feel like we have the flu. Can anyone agree/argue with me? And can anyone list reasons for knowing if you have the normal flu, or if it's swine flu? This is just ridiculous. I can't wait until there are more 'outbursts' and then a vaccine magically comes in, and pharmacies start making a shit load.

item.title: This stupid Swine Flu shit
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

[quote=“vamp256, post:21, topic:283290”][quote author=ak226688 link=topic=374353.msg2824237#msg2824237 date=1244853954]

In class everyone was coughing…even the teacher. I think swine flu has finally reached my town.
[/quote]you poor boy!!! i hope you havent got swine floo

MHM, I’ve got a cough and shit…and a sore throat…ive got two of the three symptons…[/quote]

omg u got teh same smypums as da flu!

[quote=“ak226688, post:11, topic:283290”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=374353.msg2823388#msg2823388 date=1244784255]
Funny thing about the Swine Flu. The vaccine killed more people than the actual flu.
[/quote]thats terrible![/quote]

It’s true. Places with outbreaks, as reported by third party media, kill more people who got the vaccination than who didn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: This stupid Swine Flu shit
item.dc:creator: @Barrage1 Denoria
item.description:
@Barrage1 wrote:

[quote=“JaydenD12, post:17, topic:283290”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=374353.msg2823659#msg2823659 date=1244812994]

omg lets see: ive had stomach ache for over a week, diarrhea… ive had a runny nose for a few days, i think i may have it, but ive been goin to school so…

Lolz, some Kids brang the Swine Flu towards New Zealand -.-
[/quote]

Yeah, And that’s where I live.

Here is an article from the news today;

http://www.3news.co.nz/News/NationalNews/Swine-flu-could-affect-more-than-a-million-New-Zealanders/tabid/423/articleID/108395/cat/64/Default.aspx

Key facts:

“The pandemic status confirms swine flu is circulating rapidly around the world.”
“Because most people aren’t immune to the virus it has the potential to infect more than one million New Zealanders”
“The message remains not to panic as the cases here are usually mild.”
“As yet a vaccine hasn’t been developed. But Ryall says there are still 1.2 million courses of Tamiflu in the national stock.”

Our population is just over 4 million.[/quote]I also live in New Zealand

Read full topic

item.title: This stupid Swine Flu shit
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Swine Flu is nothing. It’s a waste of money for the vaccination, and it’s no worse than the regular flu. Not many people have died, the media just makes it sound like thousands. If you get it, you just treat it like any other flu. People in Mexico die because they don’t have the same lifestyle as we do, so they can’t always treat it properly.

Read full topic

item.description:

omg lets see: ive had stomach ache for over a week, diarrhea… ive had a runny nose for a few days, i think i may have it, but ive been goin to school so…
[/quote]

Lolz, some Kids brang the Swine Flu towards New Zealand -.-[/quote]

Yeah, And that’s where I live.

Here is an article from the news today;

http://www.3news.co.nz/News/NationalNews/Swine-flu-could-affect-more-than-a-million-New-Zealanders/tabid/423/articleID/108395/cat/64/Default.aspx

Key facts:

“The pandemic status confirms swine flu is circulating rapidly around the world.”
“Because most people aren’t immune to the virus it has the potential to infect more than one million New Zealanders”
“The message remains not to panic as the cases here are usually mild.”
“As yet a vaccine hasn’t been developed. But Ryall says there are still 1.2 million courses of Tamiflu in the national stock.”

Our population is just over 4 million.

item.title: This stupid Swine Flu shit
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

sanga282:

didnt think we had a vaccine for swine flu. The reason you should take tamiflu is that it destroys the protein made by the virus strain H1N1, it makes symptoms alot less likely to occur and makes the virus a lot less lethal. It isnt a cure however it just can prevent the proteins

I’m talking about the last time we had outbreaks of the Swine Flu. 1970s I believe?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The reason behind the extreme measures is minimisation of a pandemic. The world health organisation has stated that swine flu is a pandemic, and by employing these measures we reduce the effects of it.
